title: I feel lonely
content:
In the depths of my heart, I feel the ache,
A longing, a yearning, I cannot move.
I feel lonely, like a whisper in the breeze,
lost in the vastness, searching for ease.


In the quiet moments, when the world stands still,
Loneliness engulfs me, an unwelcome chill.
I feel lonely, aching for a tender touch,
Yearning for connection, oh, how I long so much.


Amidst the crowd, I stand alone,
Aching for companionship, to call my own.
I feel lonely, as the night sky so vast,
Seeking solace, a love that will forever last.


But in the depths of my solitude's embrace,
I find strength and courage, a resilient grace.
I feel lonely, yet I'll keep on the fight,
For within this darkness, I'll find my own light.


So I'll journey through the depths of my soul,
Discovering truths that will make me whole.
Though I feel lonely, I'll strive to find my way,
In solitude's embrace, I'll learn to sway.


For even in the loneliness that I bear,
I'll find beauty and strength, a love to share.
In each whispered I feel lonely that I speak,
I'll uncover the power within, so unique.
author: Manish Yadav

title: I deserve the pain
content:
May be I deserve the pain, for I have sinned,

In my pursuit of glory, where virtues thinned.

May be I trampled on hearts, blinded by my gain,

Now in the depths of anguish, I remain.


May be I deserve the pain, for words unkind,

Flowed from my lips, leaving scars behind.

May be I tore apart souls, without remorse or care,

Now I'm haunted by echoes of despair.


May be I deserve the pain, for actions unjust,

In my selfishness, I broke trust.

May be I played with emotions, like a heartless game,

Now I'm left with regret, and lingering shame.


May be I deserve the pain, for dreams unfulfilled,

As I chose paths that left my spirit chilled.

May be I ignored my calling, and settled for less,

Now I'm left with emptiness, a bitter mess.


May be I deserve the pain, for love forsaken,

In my fear of vulnerability, hearts were taken.

May be I built walls high, shutting out the light,

Now I'm trapped in darkness, longing for respite.


May be I deserve the pain, for lessons unlearned,

As I repeated mistakes, my soul yearned.

May be I refused to grow, clinging to my pride,

Now I'm left with regrets I cannot hide.


But may be, just may be, in this pain I find,

The seeds of redemption, a chance to realign.

To mend what's broken, to heal what's torn,

And in the depths of despair, a new hope is born.


So let me embrace the pain, with an open heart,

Learn from my mistakes, and make a fresh start.

For in my darkest moments, I can truly see,

The strength within me, and who I'm meant to be.
author: Manish Yadav

title: Captive Soul
content:
He sits alone in his room,

the walls closing in on him.

He can't remember the last time,

he felt anything but numb.

Everyone left him,

his friends have all abandoned him,

and his family doesn't understand.

He feels like he's all alone in the world.

He thinks about ending it all,

About just giving up.

But he's too afraid of what might happen

if he does.

So he sits there, in his room,

the walls closing in on him.

He doesn't know what to do.

He doesn't know where to turn.

He just wants to feel something again,

anything but this emptiness.

He wants to find a purpose,

something to give his life meaning.

But he doesn't know where to start.

He's lost and alone

and he doesn't know how to find his way back.
author: Manish Yadav

title: What can we call right?
content:
In the quest for self-discovery, I tread,

Leaving everything behind, my heart led.

Unveiling the truth, the meaning of love,

An enigma unexplored, yet to rise above.


Is it enough, my efforts to lend a hand,

To fight the darkness, to take a stand?

Lost in infinite gloom, with no light in sight,

Yet, I strive to guide others towards the right.


Is it enough, my dreams of prosperity,

Saving for a future, for children to see?

A life I never had, a vision I hold dear,

Building a foundation, erasing every fear.


Is it enough, my pursuit of success,

Where failures outnumber triumphs, I confess.

But hope fuels my spirit, in the face of defeat,

For within perseverance, victory shall greet.


In this journey of self-discovery and more,

I question the worth of what lies at my core.

But with every step taken, I come to realize,

That it's in the pursuit itself, the answer lies.


For it's in the seeking, the leaving behind,

That true meaning and purpose we often find.

So I'll keep pushing forward, giving my all,

Embracing the uncertainties, standing tall.


For in the end, it's not just what I do,

But the passion and intent shine through.

And though doubts may linger, I'll continue to strive,

For it's in the journey that my soul comes alive.
author: Manish Yadav
